_prev_prog_3.CH_OtherChanges: Company Change at location, renovation of the process

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Del Real Foods, LLC.



Risk Management Plan Executive Summary



1. Accidental Release prevention and Emergency Response Policies:



We at Del Real Foods, LLC are committed to protecting people and the environment.  This commitment is demonstrated by our comprehensive accidental release prevention program that covers areas such as the design, installation, operating procedures, maintenance, and employee training associated with the ammonia refrigeration system at our facility.  It is our policy to implement appropriate control measures to prevent possible releases of anhydrous ammonia.  Unforeseeable, if such a release does occur, our highly trained employees are available to control and mitigate the release.  We are also completely coordinated with the Moore Fire Department, who provides our emergency response services.



2. The Stationary Source and the Regulated Substances Handled:



This facility was completely evacuated and renovated and is not the same process as previously was located within the facility.  We have one chemical at our facility that is subject to the Process Safety and Risk Management regulations.  That substance is Anhydrous Ammonia.  The maximum inventory of Ammonia that is expected to be present at this facility, based upon process and operational requirements, is 15,250 pounds.  The ammonia system is to be started up in phases with the NW Engine Room System starting on 10/30/2018 and consisting of 8,100# of ammonia.  The NE Engine Room System will be started on 12/1/2018 and consist of 7,150# of ammonia.  The South Engine Room was evacuated and is not planned to be in use at this time.  All three systems are separate closed loop systems within the same building.  



3. The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and the Chemical Specific Prevention Steps:



Del Real Foods, LLC. has taken the following steps, as required by 40 CFR Part 68 (EPA's Risk Management Planning regulations).  Our Ammonia (anhydrous) process is also subje

ct to section 29 CFR 1910.119 (OSHA's Process Safety Management regulations).  Our facility is also subject to the EPA's Emergency Planning and Community Right To Know Act (EPCRA) Section 302 reporting requirements.  The following sections briefly describe the elements of the release prevention program that are in place at our facility.



Process Hazard Analysis:



Our facility conducts comprehensive studies to ensure that hazards associated with our ammonia refrigeration process are identified and controlled efficiently.  The methodology used to conduct these analyses is the What-If-Checklist.  These analyses were completed by a team of qualified personnel with expertise in engineering and process operations and are revalidated at a frequency of at least every 5 years.  Any recommendations resulting from these analyses are scheduled and completed in a timely manner.



Operating Procedures:



Del Real Foods, LLC. maintains written operating procedures.  These procedures address various modes of operation such as initial start-up, normal operations, temporary operations, emergency shutdown, emergency operations, normal shutdown, and start-up after a turnaround.  The information is regularly reviewed and is readily accessible to personnel who operate and/or maintain the process.



Training:



Del Real Foods, LLC. has a comprehensive training program in place to ensure that personnel who operate and/or maintain the ammonia refrigeration system are trained and certified.  New employees receive basic classroom training in process operations, followed by on-the-job supervision until they are evaluated and determined to be competent to work independently.  Refresher training is provided at least triennially and more frequently as needed.



Mechanical Integrity:



Del Real Foods, LLC. conducts documented maintenance inspections and tests on process equipment to ensure proper operation.  Process equipment examined by these checks includes pressure vessels, storage ta

nks, piping systems, relief and vent systems, emergency shutdown systems, controls and pumps.  Qualified personnel complete inspections and tests only after they are trained.  Any corrective actions noted during these inspections and tests are completed in a timely manner.



Management of Change:



Written procedures are in place at Del Real Foods, LLC. to manage changes in process chemicals, technology, equipment and processes.  Process operators, maintenance personnel, or any other persons whose job tasks are affected by a modification of process operations, are promptly made aware of, and given, training regarding the modification.



Pre-Startup Safety Reviews:



Pre-Startup Safety reviews related to new processes and modifications to established processes are conducted when they are required at Del Real Foods, LLC.  These reviews are conducted to confirm that construction, equipment, operating and maintenance procedures are suitable for a safe start-up prior to placing any equipment into operation.



Compliance Audits:



Del Real Foods, LLC. conducts audits on a regular basis to determine whether the provisions of the Process Safety and Risk Management regulations are being implemented.  These audits are completed at least every three years and any noted corrective actions are assigned and scheduled in a timely manner.



Incident Investigation:



Del Real Foods, LLC. promptly investigates any accident or incident that has resulted in, or could reasonably have resulted in a catastrophic release of Ammonia (anhydrous).  These investigations are completed to identify the circumstances that caused the accident as well as any corrective actions to prevent the accident or incident from recurring.  All accident or incident investigation reports are retained for a minimum of 5 years.



Employee Participation:



Del Real Foods, LLC. believes that process safety, risk management and accident prevention require a team effort.  Site personnel and contractors are u

rged to express their views concerning accident prevention issues and to recommend improvements.  In addition, site personnel have access to all information created as part of the implementation of the process safety and risk management regulations, including information resulting from the process hazard analyses in particular.



Contractors:



On occasion, Del Real Foods, LLC. hires contractors to conduct specialized maintenance and construction activities.  Prior to selecting a contractor, a thorough evaluation of the contractor's safety performance is completed.  Prior to selecting a contractor, a thorough evaluation of the contractor's safety performance is conducted.  Contractors are informed of all known potential hazards related to their work on or near the ammonia refrigeration system.  Contractors are also informed of all of the procedures for notification, evacuation and accountability in the event of a site emergency due to an Ammonia (anhydrous) release.



4. 5-Year Accident History:



There have been no reportable accidents or incidents at this facility since ammonia was first introduced in October 30, 2018.



5. Emergency Response Plan:



Del Real Foods, LLC. is included in the written community emergency response plan.  The facility also has it's own emergency response plan.  The emergency response plan includes specific actions to be taken in the event of an Ammonia (anhydrous) release.  The emergency response plan also includes procedures for informing the public and local emergency response agencies in the event of an Ammonia (anhydrous) release.  The emergency response plan also includes information on emergency health care.



The local agency coordinating the facility emergency response plan is the Moore Fire Department.  Their phone number is: 

(405) 793-5110.



6. Planned Changes to Improve Safety:



Several developments and findings have resulted from the implementation of the various elements of our Process Safety Management and Ris

k Management Planning programs.  We will continue our annual facility emergency notification, evacuation and accountability drills and planning and training site visits with the Moore Fire Department in the future.  We have identified and will be changing our liquid pumps to a hermetic pump to prevent any future ammonia losses.  The previous company had two leaks from the sealed pumps in the past two years that required evacuation.  We are eliminating that issue.
